newsitem.title: USA: First Chicago, Baird in finance alliance.
newsitem.headline: First Chicago, Baird in finance alliance.

text.p: First Chicago NBD Corp and Robert W. Baird & Co Inc said they formed an alliance to be called the Baird/FCN Alliance that expands the corporate finance services of each firm.
First Chicago said it will offer clients mergers and acquisition advisory representation, as well as equity and preferred stock distribution services provided by Baird.
Baird will offer private placements, asset securitization, bank financing for acquisitions and high-yield securities provided by First Chicago NBD, the bank said.
The alliance is contractual and does not involve ownership interest of either firm in the other, the bank said.

First Chicago said it previously had an investment banking alliance with Chicago Dearborn Co that was discontinued after announcement of the purchase of a parent company of the firm, Chicago Corp, by ABN AMRO North America Inc, part of ABN AMRO Holding NV.
Baird is part of Northwestern Mutual Life Insurance Co. First Chicago NBD is the ninth largest U.S. bank holding company with assets of $106.7 billion.
